intro: Palicourea officinalis, commonly known as blue cohosh, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves, and clusters of small, white or blue flowers. Its berries are typically red or black when mature and contain seeds that are dispersed by animals. Palicourea officinalis has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
